qas.question: What was replaced by the spinning wheel?
What invention replaced laces on clothing?
What new type of windmill was invented in this period?
In what country did the blast furnace first appear?

context: In agriculture, the increased usage of sheep with long-fibred wool allowed a stronger thread to be spun. In addition, the spinning wheel replaced <a0_0>the traditional distaff<a0_0/> for spinning wool, tripling production.[AI] A less technological refinement that still greatly affected daily life was the use of <a1_0>buttons<a1_0/> as closures for garments, which allowed for better fitting without having to lace clothing on the wearer. Windmills were refined with the creation of <a2_0>the tower mill<a2_0/>, allowing the upper part of the windmill to be spun around to face the direction from which the wind was blowing. The blast furnace appeared around 1350 in <a3_0>Sweden<a3_0/>, increasing the quantity of iron produced and improving its quality. The first patent law in 1447 in <a4_0>Venice<a4_0/> protected the rights of inventors to their inventions.
